p: Soy and its products, and legume seeds (lentils, beans, peas) are one of the richest sources of isoflavones in normal food. Additionally, soybean seeds are an essential source that contain a massive amount of isoflavonoids in the human diet. However, the main sources of isoflavones are from legumes, particularly the Fabaceae family in soy and red clover [ 14]. Furthermore, isoflavones can also be found in trace quantities in some fruits such as strawberries and apples [ 15].
